content.1: The burden of Tyre. Howl, ye ships of Tarshish; for it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in: from the land of Chittim it is revealed to them.
content.2: Be still, ye inhabitants of the isle; thou whom the merchants of Zidon, that pass over the sea, have replenished.
content.3: And by great waters the seed of Sihor, the harvest of the river,
content.4: Be thou ashamed, O Zidon: for the sea hath spoken,
content.5: As at the report concerning Egypt,
content.6: Pass ye over to Tarshish; howl, ye inhabitants of the isle.
content.8: Who hath taken this counsel against Tyre, the crowning
content.10: Pass through thy land as a river, O daughter of Tarshish:
content.11: He stretched out his hand over the sea, he shook the kingdoms: the
content.12: And he said, Thou shalt no more rejoice, O thou oppressed virgin, daughter of Zidon: arise, pass over to Chittim; there also shalt thou have no rest.
content.13: Behold the land of the Chaldeans; this people was not,
content.14: Howl, ye ships of Tarshish: for your strength is laid waste.
content.15: And it shall come to pass in that day, that Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king: after the end of seventy years shall Tyre sing as an harlot.
content.16: Take an harp, go about the city, thou harlot that hast been forgotten; make sweet melody, sing many songs, that thou mayest be remembered.
